DPR Minta Fachrul Razi Tak Asal Bicara soal Celana Cingkrang
01 Nov 2019, 07:01 by Dewi Nurita, Amirullah
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Wakil Ketua Komisi VIII DPR RI (membidangi agama dan sosial), Ace Hasan Syadzily meminta Menteri Agama Fachrul Razi meluruskan pernyataannya soal larangan memakai cadar dan celana cingkrang.
"Bagi para ASN, ini menimbulkan pertanyaaan serius. Apakah penggunaan cadar dan celana cingkrang di lingkungan ASN teridentifikasi mencerminkan sikap radikalisme?" ujar Ace lewat keterangan tertulis pada Jumat, 1 November 2019.
Ace mengingatkan, pernyataan yang dilontarkan Menteri Agama seharusnya didasarkan atas kajian dan basis data yang kuat. "Jangan asal bicara sehingga menimbulkan kegaduhan dalam masyarakat," ujar Ace.
Menurutnya, menyinggung persoalan agama tanpa memiliki argumen yang kuat dikhawatirkan menimbulkan persepsi yang salah terhadap pemerintahan Jokowi.
Sebelumnya, Fachrul melontarkan pernyataan bahwa tak ada dasar agama soal penggunaan cadar, apalagi dalam aturan seragam di pemerintahan. “Kalau instansi pemerintah kan memang sudah jelas ada aturannya, kalau kamu PNS memang boleh pakai tutup muka?” ujar Fachrul.
Fachrul juga mengatakan penggunaan celana cingkrang oleh aparatur sipil negara (ASN) tidak sesuai aturan. Dia menekankan agar ASN mengikuti semua aturan, termasuk cara berpakaian. Meski tak bisa dipersoalkan dari segi agama, Fachrul menyebut celana cingkrang melanggar aturan berpakaian ASN.

The House of Representatives Asks Fachrul Razi Not to Talk About Cingkrang Pants
01 Nov 2019, 07:01 by Dewi Nurita, Amirullah
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Deputy Chairman of Commission VIII of the Indonesian House of Representatives (in charge of religion and social affairs), Ace Hasan Syadzily asked the Minister of Religion Fachrul Razi to straighten out his statement regarding the prohibition of wearing veils and pants.
"For ASNs, this raises serious questions. Does the use of veils and trousers in the ASN environment have been identified as reflecting radicalism?" Ace said through a written statement on Friday, November 1, 2019.
Ace reminded, the statement made by the Minister of Religion should be based on a strong study and database. "Don't just talk so that it causes a commotion in the community," Ace said.
According to him, alluding to the issue of religion without having a strong argument is feared to lead to wrong perceptions of the Jokowi government.
Previously, Fachrul made a statement that there was no religious basis regarding the use of the veil, especially in uniform rules in government. "If there is a government regulation, it is clear that there are rules, if you civil servants are allowed to wear a face mask," said Fachrul.
Fachrul also said the use of trouser cingkrang by the state civil service (ASN) was not according to the rules. He emphasized that ASN followed all the rules, including how to dress. Although it cannot be questioned in terms of religion, Fachrul said the Cingkrang pants violated the ASN dress code.
